detaileddescription.para: There was an error on the physical layer trying to send/receive data to/from the device. This error can happen if the device is unexpectedly unplugged.

The physical layer successfully sends and receives data, but the device does not ack correctly. This usually happens if a command was partially completed before the host aborted. The protocol needs to be reset with link_resetprot().

The physical and protocol layers successfully transferred data to/from the device and the command was correctly received. However, there was an error when the device executed the command. For example, calling link_open() on a file that does not exist on the target will return this error.
S_IFMT equivalent.
S_IFDIR equivalent.
S_IFCHR equivalent.
S_IFBLK equivalent.

Link read-only flag when opening a file/device.
Link write-only flag when opening a file/device.
Link read-write flag when opening a file/device.
Link append flag when opening a file/device.
Link create flag when opening a file/device.

This defines the opaque type used to select different USB Link devices.
This is set to the errno value reported on the target device.

This initializes the link framework. This will be called automatically by link_new_dev() if it is not called explicitly.
Zero on success.
This shuts down the link framework.

This opens a USB Link device based on the serial number.
The new device or NULL if it could not be opened
This closes the specified USB Link device.

This generates a list of available Link devices.
A pointer to the new string array.
This frees a list of USB Link devices (No USB transactions are performed).
This function checks to see if there was an error on the last transaction.
This function sets the debugging level for the library (0 for no debugging output).

This function opens a file or device on the target.
The file handle used to read/write/ioctl the file or device; less than zero on an error.

This function performs ioctl control on device associated with the file descriptor.
Zero on success or an error code.

memberdef.argsstring: (link_phy_t handle, int fildes, void *buf, int nbyte)
memberdef.name: link_read

detaileddescription.para: This function reads the device (or regular file) associated with the file descriptor.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes read or an error code (less than zero).

memberdef.argsstring: (link_phy_t handle, int fildes, const void *buf, int nbyte)
memberdef.name: link_write

detaileddescription.para: This function writes the device (or regular file) associated with the file descriptor.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes writte or an error code (less than zero).

detaileddescription.para: This function closes the device (or regular file) associated with the file descriptor.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or an error code.

briefdescription.para: The full path to the file to delete

detaileddescription.para: This function deletes a file from the device's filesystem.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or an HWPL error code.

memberdef.argsstring: (link_phy_t handle, int fildes, off_t offset, int whence)
memberdef.name: link_lseek

detaileddescription.para: For block devices, this function moves the access pointer.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or an error code.

briefdescription.para: The full path to the directory to create

detaileddescription.para:
This function creates a new directory on the device filesystem.
0 on success or an HWPL error code.

briefdescription.para: The full path to the directory to remove

detaileddescription.para:
This function removes a directory from the device filesystem.
0 on success or an HWPL error code.

briefdescription.para: The full path to the directory to open

detaileddescription.para:
This function opens a directory on the device filesystem. link_readdir() may then be used to read the entries in the directory.
0 on success or an HWPL error code.

briefdescription.para: The handle for the open directory

detaileddescription.para: This function closes a directory that was previously opened with link_opendir().

simplesect.para: 0 on success or an HWPL error code.

memberdef.argsstring: (link_phy_t handle, int dirp, struct link_dirent *entry, struct link_dirent **result)
memberdef.name: link_readdir_r

briefdescription.para: A pointer to the destination entry

detaileddescription.para:
This function reads an entry from a the directory that was previously opened with link_opendir().
0 on success or an HWPL error code.

This function formats the filesystem. All data is erased from the filesystem leaving an emtpy root directory.
0 on success or an HWPL error code.
This function starts a new process on the device.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or an HWPL error code

detaileddescription.para: This function creates a new symbolic link.

simplesect.para: Zero on success or an error code.

detaileddescription.para: This function opens the stdio. return Zero on success or an error code.
This function closes the stdio. return Zero on success or an error code.
This function reads the standard output from the device.
This function writes the standard input to the device.

This function sets the time on the target device according to the specified struct tm.
Zero on success or an error code

This function gets the time on the target device according and stores it in t.
Zero on success or an error code
This function sends the specified signal to the specified pid.
This function reads the address of the security word.
This renames a file on the filesystem.

This changes a file mode.

This function resets the device
0 on success

This function resets the device and starts the DFU bootloader.
0 on success
